Class BoardController

java.lang.Object
BoardController
Direct Known Subclasses:
BoardControllerMediumSize
public class BoardController
extends java.lang.Object
Version:
1.0.0 Nov 25, 2020
Author:
Nikola Zlokapa Controller object for the board fxml, It has a size, column and rows variable used for drawing the the circle discs on the board. It has fxml text variables for displaying information about the current game and buttons to determine what column the player wishes to drop his disc.

    • drawDisc

      protected javafx.scene.shape.Circle drawDisc​(int row, int column, int player)
      Draw a yellow or red disc on the board.
      Parameters:
      row - the row the disc will be drawn on.
      column - the column the disc will be drawn on.
      player - the current player, to detemine the colour of the disc to draw.
      Returns:

    • displayTextOutput

    • resetBoard

      protected void resetBoard()
      call the draw board method to reset the board to all white spaces.

    • makeMove

      protected void makeMove​(int column) throws java.io.IOException
      First we call the resetboard to check if the board needs to be reset (if game has finished) followed by displaying the text output on screen. find the lowest available column row to place disc. Then the makeMove method from the board object is called which will return the outcome of the game after the move has been made. depending on the outcome of the game we pass the players and result of the game to the util method getResult and finally output the disc onto the screen in the correct position. Lastly we check to see if the result returned was not null and if it wasn't that means the game has finished.
      Parameters:
      column - The column of the board the disc is being placed in.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • displayPlayersTurn

      protected void displayPlayersTurn​(Player p)
      Update the textbox to display the current players turn.
      Parameters:
      p - a player object.

    • drawPlayersMove

      protected void drawPlayersMove​(int player, int row, int column)
      Draw a disc on the position a player wishes to drop their disc, and update the textbox to show next players turn.
      Parameters:
      player - current player object.
      row - row selected by player to drop disc.
      column - column selected by player to drop disc.
